fontTheory.description: The typography system aims to provide a balance between readability and modern aesthetics. It combines traditional serif and sans-serif fonts with a monospace option for technical content.
fontTheory.readability: The chosen fonts prioritize readability by using familiar and legible typefaces suitable for various screen sizes.
fontTheory.hierarchy: The typography hierarchy is established through font weights, sizes, and styles to guide users through the document effectively.
fontTheory.fontPairings: Arial and Georgia complement each other well, providing a clear distinction between headings and body text. Helvetica is used for subtitles and buttons to add a touch of modernity.
